summary:
Floris van der Pol, Ph.D., is a specialist in management and organization of adaptive and demand-driven agricultural research and development. Presently he is engaged in chain innovation programs in Mali and Burkina Faso, improving technology for processing of agricultural products, quality management and access to markets for small producers. He also works on linking formal research with private sector partners, restructuring and streamlining the related services involving NGOs (also in Bangladesh) and Farmer Based Organizations, on funding mechanisms and on monitoring and evaluation systems. He has experience in project contract management, evaluations and reviews.

Furthermore he worked on technical and socio-economic aspects of soil degradation, the calculation of nutrient balances, the economics of nutrient application as well as on erosion control and related policies. 

Dr van der Pol has more than 33 years of experience, having worked in Algeria, Benin and Mali. He has made numerous consultancy missions for World Bank, IFAD, Asian Development Bank, Netherlands Government, OECD, FAO and CTA in Africa and Central and East Asia. 

He is member of the editorial board of the international journal Agriculture, Ecosystems and Environment.

He has special skills in computer programming and database construction.
